definition: to pass through a doorway/(of a woman) to marry/orchestral music interlude in an opera
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: I’ll make sure there’s a video-review process for close calls on the goal line.
sentences.chinese: 我将确保在擦过门线的过程中提供视频重放。

sentences.english: The old man forgot closing the door.
sentences.chinese: 那个老人忘记关过门了。

sentences.english: I have not stirred out all morning .
The unfortunate girl got the wrong side of her mother-in-law from the start.
sentences.chinese: 这个倒霉的姑娘一过门就得罪了婆婆。

sentences.english: Hey, Melanie, the neighbours just knocked at the door.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，梅勒妮，邻居刚才来敲过门。

sentences.english: They edged the piano through the door.
sentences.chinese: 他们把钢琴慢慢抬过门去。

sentences.english: The bride had only one sure ally on her wedding day.
sentences.chinese: 新娘过门那天，身边只有一个体己人。

definition: first return of bride to her parental home
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
(of a child bride) to consummate marriage
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
to take a wife/to get married (man)
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
